q: Donald Rumsfeld arrives bang on time and greets me with a disconcertingly warm smile. He is dressed formally in a grey suit, pale blue shirt and striped tie. He sits down and swiftly asks me a question: Have you read the book? What was your reaction? I say that I have read most of the book on the flight over from London and that I had enjoyed it- particularly the early chapters about his life growing up in suburban Chicago and his memories
